Tenneco Clear PVID and VGDA

#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<># NOTE This process is dependent upon the following condition(s) being met:

- A new Email group is defined as TA-San o TA-SAN to include all SAN Adminstrators who will/may assign disk from the EMC platforms for use by the UNIX Team #<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<>#<># End of NOTE

  1. The SAN administrator will present the disks to pgdskcln
  2. The unix admin should execute the following commands to clean the LVM metadata.
    1. Remove the pvid
      chdev -l <hdiskname> -a pv=clear
    2. Remove VGDA
      chpv -C <hdiskname>

      Example 

      chpv -C hdiskpower129
  3. Once done, remove the disks from AIX kernel
    1. Remove from powerpath
      powermt remove dev=hdiskpowername
    2. Remove the devicefile
      rmdev -dl <hdiskpowername>
    3. Remove the child devices
      rmdev -dl hdiskname
rmdev -dl hdiskname

      If the disk has more than 2 paths, remove all the 4 hdisk child devices.
